Yes, it is possible to enjoy horror films without focusing on their portrayal of gender roles. Many people watch horror films for pure entertainment and may not even consider the societal implications of the gender roles portrayed in the film. However, it's important to recognize that media can have an impact on our attitudes and beliefs, even if we are not consciously aware of it.

Moreover, people who are already marginalized by traditional gender norms, such as women and members of the LGBTQ+ community, may be more acutely aware of the impact of gender representation in media, and may not be able to simply "turn off" their concerns about gender roles in horror films.

Ultimately, it's up to each individual to determine their own relationship with media and decide how much they want to engage with it critically. However, it's important to recognize that representation matters and that media can have an impact on our attitudes and beliefs, whether we are consciously aware of it or not.
